results.creator_credit: John Mills and Formula One Films
results.brief_description: Looks at the design of a new image and packaging concept for a range of toilet products soon to be marketed. Shows the range of Letraset materials and their application.

results.title: Partners in curriculum
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: A program which encourages the participation of teachers, students, parents and school based groups and committees in the planning and development of school curriculum. Examples of how this is happening at Mt. Clear High School, Tallangatta High School and Williamstown High School are shown. Curriculum support services are also briefly mentioned.

results.title: Participation for all (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ian Andrews and Burbank Audio Visual
results.brief_description: Describes an elementary school program for all grade levels, how to develop student leadership, and ways of modifying a variety of indoor and outdoor activities to maximise the use of all available space and equipment.

results.title: Participation and equity program
results.brief_description: Outlines the philosophy behind the Participation and Equity Program and provides an overview of the ways in which some schools throughout Australia are implementing programs that are attempting to come to terms with overcoming barriers to effective participation by students in education. Changes in curriculum, school research community groups, and the teaching of English as a second language are just some of the methods outlined. No other credits.

results.title: Parkville
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A lyrical look at this small historical, Melbourne suburb. Parkville is characterised by Victorian mansions, terraced houses, cast iron, park railings and ivy-clad columns. Social life is carried on in the wide streets, parklands and pubs. An atmospheric film of beautiful images featuring background low-key guitar music. Made by the students of Swinburne with the assistance of the Parkville Association.

results.title: Parks are for people, but...
results.brief_description: Considers some of the environmental problems resulting from the use of parks by people in their various activities. Takes, as an example, Kosciusko State Park in the Snowy Mountains and the problems it represents for the management of the park. Cast includes Margaret Newport, Frances Miller, Anne Miller, Geoff Drummond, Peter Hunt, Pat Drummond. Director, photographer, editor: Damon Smith; photographer: Karen Wynn; sound: Peter Moylan; music: Pat Drummond, Peter Hunt; songs: John Polson; commentary: Martin Williams.

results.title: Park here
results.creator_credit: John Eldridge, Ralph Keene and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: This film gives an account of the proposed scheme for national parks in Great Britain. In congested areas where there is insufficient open space for recreation, damage is often done because both children and adults need recreation, and take it al the expense of, for instance, some farmer’s property. Plans for the proposed beauty spots and parks to be reserved include places in the Lakes District, North Wales, Dartmoor, South Downs, Dovedale, Pembrokeshire Coast and Grassholm

results.title: Paris: the city and the people
results.brief_description: Uses a dialogue between a visiting American and a Parisian to provide the framework for a visual tour of Paris. Shows how a combination of French culture, industrial progress and economic growth has made Paris into a great capital. Includes views of the Eiffel Tower, the Cathedral of Notre Dame de Paris, and the Arc de Triomphe.

results.title: Paris: living space
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Understanding Cities”.
A fascinating documentary that looks at the development and expansion of Paris. The film looks at the growth of the city in organised patterns and it also looks at the various people, throughout history, who influenced the design of Paris.
